title: Vauxhall jobs under threat from carmakers' mega-merger
text:
British jobs could be under threat if the potential merger of Vauxhall's owner PSA with Fiat Chrysler goes ahead.

PSA owns the Ellesmere Port plant that makes the Astra - one of Britain’s bestselling cars - but there are fears it could be closed if the tie-up goes ahead.

Merging the two manufacturers would create an industry powerhouse that sold 8.6m cars last year.

However, both PSA and Fiat Chrysler have factories across Europe running below capacity, meaning rationalisation and closures are likely to create savings.
